data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Step backwards involves doing the following: 1st Step Forward Step to right Step right Step to left Step to left Step first Step Forward Step to left Step to right Step first Step backwards Includes: 1st Step Left Step to right Step to left Step to right Step first Step Forward Step to left Step to right Step first Step backwards Includes: 1st Step 10 Steps to left Step to right Step first Step left Step to right So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can turn around and back by turning around. The starting point is on the left as you walk around. So, the answer is Yes.

If you take 6 steps you are back in the starting point. If you take 4 steps you are back in the starting point. Turn around and take 10 steps to return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

No it is not possible to take 5 steps back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

Turn around every 7 steps and then turn opposite way. Turn around every 7 steps and turn around. Turn right 7 times, turn around to another direction. So, the answer is No.

To turn around, you need to take at least 8 steps. To take two steps back, you need to take 2 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you always face forward, you never return to the same position you were in. So, the answer is No.

If you follow the instructions, you cannot get back to the starting point from the direction you left. So, the answer is No.

When you make a forward movement, you are now looking forward while moving backward. If you continue to face forward, you will take four steps. If you take forward movement and take 3 steps forward, you are now looking forward. So, the answer is No.

You should always face forward when passing. Backward is not the same as forward. If you face right, it will also be difficult to navigate backward. So, the answer is No.

If you complete this sequence right, you always face forward. All right – 4 steps right. If you complete this sequence left, you always face forward. Do I take 3 steps left or 4 steps right? No. Do I take 6 steps left or 4 steps right? No. Do I take 3 steps forward or 4 steps right? Yes. So, the answer is No.

In this method, the right and left should always be facing the same way, the left should always face forward. The answer: Yes.

As you take the first step you should always keep head forward and face forward. If you can return to the beginning, you go back to first step. Twice your distance in a direction changes. If you turn right again you will take 15 steps. If you turn left you will take 8 steps. If you turn right again you will take 12 steps. Turning right and taking 10 steps will return you to the starting point. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 8 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Take 4 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

In the first step, when facing forward, you can’t take 10 steps backward. If you’re facing forward, you can take 7 steps left and 8 steps right and take a total of 7 + 8 + 8 = 38 steps in total. In the second step, when facing forward, you can take 7 steps right and 8 steps right and take a total of 8 + 8 = 32 steps in total. If you’re facing backward and facing forward, you can take 10 steps backward and take a total of 10 steps backward. In the third step, when facing left, you can take 7 steps left and 9 steps right and take a total of 9 + 8 = 18 steps in total. In the fourth step, when facing left, you can take 7 steps left and 3 steps right and take a total of 4 + 3 = 5 steps in total. In the fifth step, when facing left, you can take 4 steps left and 3 steps right and take a total of 5 + 2 = 7 steps in total. Thus, the answer is No.
